title: Zdeno Chara’s 10 most memorable moments with the Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Zdeno Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame, reflecting his legacy as a dominant Boston Bruins captain.
Chara signed with the Bruins in 2006, catalyzing a successful era, including a Stanley Cup win in 2011.
Chara set the NHL record for the hardest shot at 108.8 mph during the 2012 All-Star skills competition.

title: Bill Belichick reflects on ‘learning curve’ during first season coaching college football
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Bill Belichick discusses the challenges of transitioning to college football as head coach of University of North Carolina.
UNC is currently 4-5 under Belichick, tenth in the ACC, and needs two wins from the remaining three games to match last year's total.
Belichick believes a better initial assessment of player potential could have improved early season performance.

title: Patriots have 15 players land on injury report, but get some good news
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots listed 15 players on their injury report, including notable players Christian Barmore and Rhamondre Stevenson.
Kayshon Boutte and Rhamondre Stevenson were limited participants in practice, showing signs of recovery from their respective injuries.
Austin Hooper did not participate in Monday's walk-through due to a concussion, ahead of Thursday's game against the Jets.

title: Georgia man allegedly stole millions in unclaimed Mass. property
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Shaka Stayman, 44, of Atlanta, accused of stealing $1.1 million in unclaimed Massachusetts property funds.
Stayman faces 25 charges, including larceny and money laundering, after alleged fraudulent claims on deceased individuals' property.
Investigators blocked $2.2 million in potential fraudulent claims; Stayman held on $2 million bail awaiting trial.

title: TreVeyon Henderson explained why he looked at the sideline during key TD run
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: TreVeyon Henderson was unsure whether to score or run down the clock during a key touchdown play.
Henderson hesitated and looked to the sideline for guidance on the strategic play decision.
Henderson's performance secured his first 100-yard game and multiple touchdowns, reflecting increased role amid injuries.

title: Mason Lohrei is latest Bruins player to respond from a Marco Sturm benching
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei returned to the Bruins' lineup against Toronto, recording two assists after being benched for five games.
Coach Marco Sturm benched Lohrei for defensive struggles but praised his playmaking during the Bruins' 5-3 win over the Maple Leafs.
The Bruins have maintained strong accountability, with multiple players improving after benchings, contributing to their recent success.

title: Petitioners gathering signatures to repeal legal marijuana accused of misleading voters
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Petitioners seeking to repeal recreational marijuana in Massachusetts are accused of misleading voters to sign petitions.
The state received complaints about deceptive practices, but cannot confirm investigations; voters advised to verify petition content.
Complaints include misrepresentation of petitions as unrelated issues, such as affordable housing, at public signature gathering spots.

title: Massachusetts state payroll hits $9B in 2025 — UMass system dominates
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts state payroll reached $9.19 billion in 2025, with a slight decrease from $10.26 billion in 2024.
University of Massachusetts system's payroll was $1.55 billion, leading state workforce expenses, with top-paid employees from UMass.
MBTA ranked second in state payroll at $799.68 million, followed by the Trial Court at $574.67 million.

title: Mass. State Police: 56 arrested in three-day child exploitation sweep
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts State Police arrested 56 people in a child exploitation sweep called Operation Firewall over three days.
Authorities seized 229 electronic devices and executed 34 residential search warrants, with charges including child pornography and attempted child enticement.
Suspects ranged in age from 18 to 75, and included businesspeople and parents, highlighting the challenge of identifying potential offenders.

title: 5 ways to help fight food insecurity in the North Shore right now
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Community members can build snack bags or organize food drives at Beverly Bootstraps' food pantry.
La Colaborativa in Chelsea offers volunteer opportunities for food distribution and accepting donations.
Salem Pantry provides Thanksgiving meals, with options to donate or volunteer for distribution tasks.
